verse: After this I saw another angel coming down from heaven, having great authority, and the earth was illuminated with his glory.
He cried out mightily with a loud voice, saying:
Then I heard another voice from heaven saying:
“The kings of the earth, who have committed adultery and lived luxuriously with her, will weep and mourn over her when they see the smoke of her burning.
Standing far off for the fear of her torment, they will say:
“The merchants of the earth will weep and mourn over her, for no one buys their merchandise any more:

the merchandise of gold, silver, precious stones and pearls, fine linen, purple, silk and scarlet, all kinds of scented wood, all artifacts of ivory, all merchandise of costly wood, bronze, iron, and marble;
and cinnamon and incense, myrrh and frankincense, wine, oil, fine flour and wheat, cattle and sheep, horses and chariots, and slaves and souls of men.
“The merchants of these things, who gained wealth by her, will stand far off for fear of her torment, weeping and wailing,
and cried out when they saw the smoke of her burning, saying, ‘What city is like this great city?’
They threw dust on their heads and cried out, weeping and wailing, and saying:
Then a mighty angel took up a stone like a great millstone and threw it into the sea, saying:
